name: Profane Prayers
text: Profane Prayers deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life, where X is the number of Clerics on the battlefield.

editions.flavor: "We have ways to make you talk, but you have nothing interesting to say."

name: Profaner of the Dead
text:
Exploit (When this creature enters the battlefield, you may sacrifice a creature.)
When Profaner of the Dead exploits a creature, return to their owners' hands all creatures your opponents control with toughness less than the exploited creature's toughness.

name: Profit
text:
Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

name: Profound Journey
text:
Return target permanent card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Rebound (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. At the beginning of your next upkeep, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

name: Progenitor Mimic
text: You may have Progenitor Mimic enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield, except it gains "At the beginning of your upkeep, if this creature isn't a token, create a token that's a copy of this creature."

name: Progenitus
text:
Protection from everything
If Progenitus would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Progenitus and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.

editions.flavor: The Soul of the World has returned.
The Soul of the World has returned.
The Soul of the World has returned.

name: Prognostic Sphinx
text:
Flying
Discard a card: Prognostic Sphinx gains hexproof until end of turn. Tap it.
Whenever Prognostic Sphinx attacks, scry 3. (Look at the top three cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.)

name: Prohibit
text:
Kicker {2} (You may pay an additional {2} as you cast this spell.)
Counter target spell if its converted mana cost is 2 or less. If Prohibit was kicked, counter that spell if its converted mana cost is 4 or less instead.

name: Promised Kannushi
text: Soulshift 7 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 7 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

name: Promise of Bunrei
text: When a creature you control dies, sacrifice Promise of Bunrei. If you do, create four 1/1 colorless Spirit creature tokens.

editions.flavor: "I am not afraid to die today nor afraid of what death will bring."

name: Promise of Power
text:
Choose one —
• You draw five cards and you lose 5 life.
• Create an X/X black Demon creature token with flying, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
Entwine {4} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic

name: Propaganda
text: Creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature he or she controls that's attacking you.

editions.flavor:
"The cost of your opposition will be extracted from your wits."
—Nekusar, the Mindrazer

"You've failed Gerrard. You've failed the Legacy. You've failed yourself. I can do no more."
—Volrath, to Karn

"You've failed Gerrard. You've failed the Legacy. You've failed yourself. I can do no more."
—Volrath, to Karn

"The cost of your opposition will be extracted from your wits."
—Nekusar, the Mindrazer

name: Propeller Pioneer
text:
Flying
Fabricate 1 (When this creature enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on it or create a 1/1 colorless Servo artifact creature token.)

editions.flavor: "The sky isn't the limit. It's the starting point."

name: Proper Burial
text: Whenever a creature you control dies, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

editions.flavor: Properly honored dead gain the peace of the grave and freedom from the call of the Ghost Quarter.

name: Prophecy
text:
Reveal the top card of target opponent's library. If it's a land, you gain 1 life. Then that player shuffles his or her library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

name: Prophetic Bolt
text: Prophetic Bolt deals 4 damage to target creature or player. Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

name: Prophetic Flamespeaker
text:
Double strike, trample
Whenever Prophetic Flamespeaker deals combat damage to a player, exile the top card of your library. You may play it this turn.

editions.flavor: Fire to destroy. Fire to create.

name: Prophetic Prism
text:
When Prophetic Prism enters the battlefield, draw a card.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: To understand Ravnica, one must first understand how each guild contributes to its stability.
"The explorer who found it got a bad deal when he sold it. He merely got rich."
To understand Kaladesh, one must first understand how aether and invention flow together through the great Aether Cycle.
"The explorer who found it got a bad deal when he sold it. He merely got rich."

name: Prophetic Ravings
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste and "{T}, Discard a card: Draw a card."

editions.flavor: "Keep your herons and shrews! You will find nothing in the moon, for the moon is a lie! It has told me so!"

name: Prophet of Distortion
text:
Devoid (This card has no color.)
{3}{C}: Draw a card. ({C} represents colorless mana.)

editions.flavor: It doesn't twist words. It twists worlds.

name: Prophet of Kruphix
text:
Untap all creatures and lands you control during each other player's untap step.
You may cast creature spells as though they had flash.

editions.flavor: "Time is fluid as a dance, and truth as fleeting."
"Time is fluid as a dance, and truth as fleeting."

name: Proposal
text: Allows Richard to propose to Lily. If the proposal is accepted both players win; mix the cards in play, both libraries, and both graveyards as a shared deck.

name: Prosperity
text: Each player draws X cards.

editions.flavor:
"Wealth is a good thing, compared to poverty—your food is better, your robes are softer, and your companions have bathed more recently."
—Kukemssa pirate
"Life can never be too good."

"Wealth is a good thing, compared to poverty—your food is better, your robes are softer, and your companions have bathed more recently."
—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate

"True riches are found in the mazes of the mind."
—Tamiyo, the Moon Sage

name: Prossh, Skyraider of Kher
text:
Flying
When you cast Prossh, Skyraider of Kher, create X 0/1 red Kobold creature tokens named Kobolds of Kher Keep, where X is the amount of mana spent to cast Prossh.
Sacrifice another creature: Prossh gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

name: Protean Hulk
text: When Protean Hulk dies, search your library for any number of creature cards with total converted mana cost 6 or less and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor:
"Meat and eggs. We eat!"
—Borborygmos

name: Protean Hydra
text:
Protean Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Protean Hydra, prevent that damage and remove that many +1/+1 counters from it.
Whenever a +1/+1 counter is removed from Protean Hydra, put two +1/+1 counters on it at the beginning of the next end step.

name: Protect
text:
Target creature gets +2/+4 until end of turn.
Fuse (You may cast one or both halves of this card from your hand.)

name: Protection of the Hekma
text: If a source an opponent controls would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.

editions.flavor: Part of the acolytes' training is to walk along the Hekma, staring out at the ravenous horrors kept at bay by the God-Pharaoh's barrier.

name: Protective Bubble
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

editions.flavor: Skilled merrow rudders ensure their charges arrive on time and without incident.

name: Protective Sphere
text: {1}, Pay 1 life: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you this turn by a source of your choice that shares a color with the mana spent on this activation cost. (Colorless mana prevents no damage.)

name: Protector of the Crown
text:
When Protector of the Crown enters the battlefield, you become the monarch.
All damage that would be dealt to you is dealt to Protector of the Crown instead.

editions.flavor: "I gladly offer my weapon and my life to the glory of my sovereign."

name: Proteus Machine
text:
Morph {0} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Proteus Machine is turned face up, it becomes the creature type of your choice. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Proteus Staff
text: {2}{U}, {T}: Put target creature on the bottom of its owner's library. That creature's controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield and the rest on the bottom of his or her library in any order. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

name: Protomatter Powder
text: {4}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Protomatter Powder: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"There is no such thing as scrap metal. All such material can be repaired with the proper bonding agent."
—Quennus, metallurgeon

name: Prototype Portal
text:
Imprint — When Prototype Portal enters the battlefield, you may exile an artifact card from your hand.
{X}, {T}: Create a token that's a copy of the exiled card. X is the converted mana cost of that card.

name: Providence
text:
You may reveal this card from your opening hand. If you do, at the beginning of the first upkeep, your life total becomes 26.
Your life total becomes 26.

editions.flavor: There is power in prayer, regardless of who is listening.

name: Provoke
text:
Untap target creature you don't control. That creature blocks this turn if able.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: Mirri did not have time to think, only to react.
Mirri did not have time to think, only to react.
Mirri did not have time to think, only to react.

"Never start a fight you can't finish."
—Padril, council guardian

name: Prowess of the Fair
text: Whenever another nontoken Elf is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.

editions.flavor: An elvish duel is a thing of beauty: the warriors' grace, the crash of steel, then the artful spray of blood.

name: Prowler's Helm
text:
Equipped creature can't be blocked except by Walls.
Equip {2}

editions.flavor:
"The youths prattle on about heroic deeds, but avoiding the noose is a feat more daring than their entire careers."
—Basarios the Blade

name: Prowling Nightstalker
text: Prowling Nightstalker can't be blocked except by black creatures.

editions.flavor: Silent as a serpent, twisted as a lone bog tree, evil as Tojira's heart.
Silent as a serpent, twisted as a lone bog tree, evil as Tojira's heart.

name: Prowling Pangolin
text: When Prowling Pangolin enters the battlefield, any player may sacrifice two creatures. If a player does, sacrifice Prowling Pangolin.

editions.flavor: "Wait, are we the decoys?"
It's always hungry, yet easily sated.

name: Prowling Serpopard
text:
Prowling Serpopard can't be countered.
Creature spells you control can't be countered.

editions.flavor: The viziers serving Rhonas, the god of strength, maintain the menagerie of animals employed during his trial.

name: Prying Questions
text: Target opponent loses 3 life and puts a card from his or her hand on top of his or her library.

editions.flavor: What remained of the Lunarch Inquisition found new ways to extract confessions.

name: Psionic Blast
text: Psionic Blast deals 4 damage to target creature or player and 2 damage to you.

name: Psionic Entity
text: {T}: Psionic Entity deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to itself.

editions.flavor: Creatures of the Æther are notorious for neglecting their own well-being.
Creatures of the Æther are notorious for neglecting their own well-being.

name: Psionic Gift
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

editions.flavor: For sale: Complete wizard's library. Rare scrolls, grimoires, and works of ancient spellcrafting! Slightly abridged.

name: Psionic Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have "{T}: This creature deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to itself."

editions.flavor: They evolved the ability to concentrate their neural activity into a single pulse, causing a disruptive but usually suicidal blast of psionic energy.

name: Psychatog
text:
Discard a card: Psychatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Exile two cards from your graveyard: Psychatog gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

name: Psychic Allergy
text:
As Psychic Allergy enters the battlefield, choose a color.
At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Psychic Allergy deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of nontoken permanents of the chosen color he or she controls.
At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy Psychic Allergy unless you sacrifice two Islands.

name: Psychic Barrier
text: Counter target creature spell. Its controller loses 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"I tolerate Phyrexians because the dragon requires it. But I have no patience for uninvited guests."
—Tezzeret

name: Psychic Battle
text: Whenever a player chooses one or more targets, each player reveals the top card of his or her library. The player who reveals the card with the highest converted mana cost may change the target or targets. If two or more cards are tied for highest cost, the target or targets remain unchanged. Changing targets this way doesn't trigger abilities of permanents named Psychic Battle.

name: Psychic Drain
text: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard and you gain X life.

editions.flavor:
"Gold can be reearned, goods restored. The moroii steal youth, more precious than either, and once gone, it's gone forever."
—Berta Suszat, civic healer

name: Psychic Intrusion
text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from that player's graveyard or hand and exile it. You may cast that card for as long as it remains exiled, and you may spend mana as though it were mana of any color to cast that spell.

name: Psychic Membrane
text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Psychic Membrane blocks, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: The vedalken always put their best thought forward.

name: Psychic Miasma
text: Target player discards a card. If a land card is discarded this way, return Psychic Miasma to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor:
"A mind may be steeled against madness, but all battlements fall in time."
—Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur

name: Psychic Network
text: Each player reveals the top card of his or her library to all other players by continuously holding it against his or her forehead. This does not allow a player to look at his or her own card. (That card still counts as the top card of your library. Whenever you draw a card, draw that one and replace it with the next card of your library.)

name: Psychic Overload
text:
Enchant permanent
When Psychic Overload enters the battlefield, tap enchanted permanent.
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
Enchanted permanent has "Discard two artifact cards: Untap this permanent."

name: Psychic Possession
text:
Enchant opponent
Skip your draw step.
Whenever enchanted opponent draws a card, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: "You will do the thinking for the both of us!"

name: Psychic Puppetry
text:
You may tap or untap target permanent.
Splice onto Arcane {U} (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

name: Psychic Purge
text:
Psychic Purge deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Psychic Purge, that player loses 5 life.

name: Psychic Rebuttal
text:
Counter target instant or sorcery spell that targets you.
Spell mastery — If there are two or more instant and/or sorcery cards in your graveyard, you may copy the spell countered this way. You may choose new targets for the copy.

editions.flavor: "I know what you're thinking," Jace whispered in the mage's mind. "It's not going to work."

name: Psychic Spear
text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a Spirit or Arcane card from it. That player discards that card.

editions.flavor:
"The wizards of Takenuma Swamp faced the horrors of humanity every day. It's no wonder they fared so well against the kami."
—Observations of the Kami War

name: Psychic Spiral
text: Shuffle all cards from your graveyard into your library. Target player puts that many cards from the top of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: An elocutor forces criminals to confess to the laws they merely intended to break.

name: Psychic Strike
text: Counter target spell. Its controller puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

editions.flavor: Until more information could be gleaned about Niv-Mizzet's intentions, Lazav took every opportunity to stall his experiments.

name: Psychic Surgery
text: Whenever an opponent shuffles his or her library, you may look at the top two cards of that library. You may exile one of those cards. Then put the rest on top of that library in any order.

name: Psychic Theft
text: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose an instant or sorcery card from it and exile that card. You may cast that card for as long as it remains exiled. At the beginning of the next end step, if you haven't cast the card, return it to its owner's hand.

name: Psychic Trance
text: Until end of turn, Wizards you control gain "{T}: Counter target spell."

editions.flavor: The Riptide Project was perhaps the only school devoted to preventing the spread of knowledge.

name: Psychic Transfer
text: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.

editions.flavor:
"The memory of your existence will fade like the final stars of morning."
—Kaervek

"The memory of your existence will fade like the final stars of morning."
—Kaervek

name: Psychic Venom
text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

name: Psychic Vortex
text:
Cumulative upkeep—Draw a card. (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice a land and discard your hand.

editions.flavor:
"Tolaria floats upon a wheel of fortune."
—Ertai, wizard adept

name: Psychogenic Probe
text: Whenever a spell or ability causes a player to shuffle his or her library, Psychogenic Probe deals 2 damage to him or her.

editions.flavor: The same devices sold as surgeons' tools in Lumengrid are sold as implements of torture in Mephidross.

name: Psychosis Crawler
text:
Psychosis Crawler's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
Whenever you draw a card, each opponent loses 1 life.

editions.flavor:
"If that brain can't figure out the secret of the serum, then add more brains."
—Rhmir, Hand of the Augur

"If that brain can't figure out the secret of the serum, then add more brains."
—Rhmir, Hand of the Augur
"If that brain can't figure out the secret of the serum, then add more brains."—Rhmir, Hand of the Augur

"If that brain can't figure out the secret of the serum, then add more brains."
—Rhmir, Hand of the Augur

name: Psychotic Episode
text:
Target player reveals his or her hand and the top card of his or her library. You choose a card revealed this way. That player puts the chosen card on the bottom of his or her library.
Madness {1}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

name: Psychotic Fury
text:
Target multicolored creature gains double strike until end of turn.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor:
"Rage, my servants. Our ancient power is renewed in blood."
—Rakdos

name: Psychotic Haze
text:
Psychotic Haze deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
Madness {1}{B} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

name: Psychotrope Thallid
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a spore counter on Psychotrope Thallid.
Remove three spore counters from Psychotrope Thallid: Create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
{1}, Sacrifice a Saproling: Draw a card.

name: Pteron Ghost
text:
Flying
Sacrifice Pteron Ghost: Regenerate target artifact.

editions.flavor: Defending to the death isn't always enough.

name: Public Execution
text: Destroy target creature an opponent controls. Each other creature that player controls gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Though the executioner did not speak, the villagers got the message.
Though the executioner did not speak, the villagers got the message.

name: Puca's Mischief
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exchange control of target nonland permanent you control and target nonland permanent an opponent controls with an equal or lesser converted mana cost.

name: Puffer Extract
text: {X}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step.

editions.flavor: The puffer's flesh is the deadliest in the sea—and therefore the most useful.

name: Pull from Eternity
text: Put target face-up exiled card into its owner's graveyard.

editions.flavor:
It is best to conquer dragons before they hatch.
—Femeref adage

name: Pull from the Deep
text: Return up to one target instant card and up to one target sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand. Exile Pull from the Deep.

editions.flavor: Ideas, not stones, form the true foundation of Meletis.

name: Pull from Tomorrow
text: Draw X cards, then discard a card.

editions.flavor:
"I do things in my own time."
—Etha, initiate of Rhet crop

name: Pulling Teeth
text: Clash with an opponent. If you win, target player discards two cards. Otherwise, that player discards a card. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Pull Under
text: Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Although nowhere on Kamigawa was safe during the war, the Takenuma Swamp was the most horrifying. The rotting bamboo itself rebelled against its mortal inhabitants, pulling them into unmarked graves."
—Observations of the Kami War

name: Pulmonic Sliver
text:
All Sliver creatures have flying.
All Slivers have "If this permanent would be put into a graveyard, you may put it on top of its owner's library instead."

editions.flavor: Like a great bellows it hisses, and its kin, both living and dead, are lifted to safety.

name: Pulsating Illusion
text:
Flying
Discard a card: Pulsating Illusion gets +4/+4 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

name: Pulsemage Advocate
text: {T}: Return three target cards from an opponent's graveyard to his or her hand. Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor: "Our unity revives our hopes."

name: Pulse of Llanowar
text: If a basic land you control is tapped for mana, it produces mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type.

editions.flavor:
"Gaea's memory is eternal, and she exists in all things."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

name: Pulse of Murasa
text: Return target creature or land card from a graveyard to its owner's hand. You gain 6 life.

editions.flavor: "Little flower twirl and bloom, arise from this your rocky tomb. Little warrior slash and brawl, be born again to free us all."

name: Pulse of the Dross
text: Target player reveals three cards from his or her hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card. Then if that player has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Dross to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before tyrants or torturers, there was evil.

name: Pulse of the Fields
text: You gain 4 life. Then if an opponent has more life than you, return Pulse of the Fields to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before religion or civilization, there was order.

name: Pulse of the Forge
text: Pulse of the Forge deals 4 damage to target player. Then if that player has more life than you, return Pulse of the Forge to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before wars or weapons, there was anger.

name: Pulse of the Grid
text: Draw two cards, then discard a card. Then if an opponent has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Grid to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before labs or lectures, there was insight.

name: Pulse of the Tangle
text: Create a 3/3 green Beast creature token. Then if an opponent controls more creatures than you, return Pulse of the Tangle to its owner's hand.

editions.flavor: Before predators or prey, there was life.

name: Pulse Tracker
text: Whenever Pulse Tracker attacks, each opponent loses 1 life.

editions.flavor: Pulse trackers terrorize adventurers, driving them through the jungle toward certain death at the gates of Malakir.

"You can't think your way out of this, Jace. Thought implies life, and life requires a pulse—music to a hunter's ears."
—Vraska

name: Pulverize
text:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay Pulverize's mana cost.
Destroy all artifacts.

name: Punctuate
text: Punctuate deals damage to target creature equal to half the number of punctuation marks in that creature's text box. (The punctuation marks are  ? , ; : - ( ) / " ' & .)

editions.flavor: "Ooh—right in the colon."

name: Puncture Blast
text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Puncture Blast deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: Gnarltrunk didn't remember having quite that many knotholes.

name: Puncture Bolt
text: Puncture Bolt deals 1 damage to target creature. Put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

editions.flavor: Cinder pyromancers measure their success by counting their enemies' smoking holes.
